vague_description: The issue involves determining the optimal distribution of limited resources to maximize output in a specific training scenario.
detailed_description: A dog school trains labradors and golden retrievers to deliver newspapers. A labrador can deliver \param{LabradorNewspaperCount} newspapers at a time and requires \param{LabradorBoneTreatCount} small bone treats for service. A golden retriever can deliver \param{GoldenRetrieverNewspaperCount} newspapers at a time and requires \param{GoldenRetrieverBoneTreatCount} small bone treats per service. The school only has \param{TotalBoneTreatsAvailable} small bone treats available. In addition, at least \param{MinGoldenRetrievers} golden retrievers must be used and at most \param{MaxLabradorProportion} of the dogs can be labradors. How many of each dog should be used to maximize the number of newspapers that can be delivered?
target_objective: Maximize the total number of newspapers delivered by labradors and golden retrievers
target_constraints: Number of golden retrievers is non-negative
Total number of bone treats used by labradors and golden retrievers cannot exceed TotalBoneTreatsAvailable
At least MinGoldenRetrievers golden retrievers must be used
At most MaxLabradorProportion of the total number of dogs can be labradors
target_parameters: Number of newspapers a labrador can deliver at a time
Number of bone treats required for a labrador service
Number of newspapers a golden retriever can deliver at a time
Number of bone treats required for a golden retriever service
Total number of small bone treats available
Minimum number of golden retrievers that must be used
Maximum proportion of dogs that can be labradors
